intro: Markea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian markea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
